snippet: Russia’s United Nations ambassador, the current Security Council president, said in an interview that he opposed any measure allowing military action.
abstract: European bid for United Nations Security Council resolution to allow military inspection and seizure of boats suspected of smuggling migrants in Mediterranean Sea meets with resistance from Russia, which says proposal is too broad in scope and could lead to military overreach.
lead_paragraph: Russia’s United Nations ambassador, the current Security Council president, said in an interview that he opposed any measure allowing military action.

headline.main: Russia Resisting Europe Request for Tough U.N. Anti-Smuggling Step
headline.print_headline: Russia Has Reservations on Push for Naval Action

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
